definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
chest and hypochondrium/upper part of the body
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2

definition: (in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
